trans-unit.source: Provides the XAML type system identifier for a member if the member is also a XAML directive.
XAML readers and XAML writers use the XamlDirective identifier during processing of member nodes.

The identifier is used when the XAML reader is positioned on a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType"></xref> and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsDirective*> is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
XamlDirective provides expected values for the XAML type system when the member is a XAML directive.

By definition, a XAML directive has characteristics that always return the same results for a subset of the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> properties, and the same XAML type system information is reported for all possible XAML directives.

The reporting of XAML type system characteristics that are specific to directives is accomplished by internal behavior or through overrides of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> `Lookup*` virtual members in the XamlDirective class.

The following list shows the returned results of a XAML directive for <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> when the member is actually a XamlDirective: - <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.LookupCustomAttributeProvider%2A> is always `null`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.DeferringLoader%2A> is always `null`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.DependsOn%2A> is always `null`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsAmbient%2A> is always `false`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsAttachable%2A> is always `false`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsDirective%2A> is always `true`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsEvent%2A> is always `false`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsReadOnly%2A> is always `false`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsReadPublic%2A> is always `true`.
- <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsWritePublic%2A> is always `true`.
Also, the internal backing for <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.DeclaringType%2A> remains unset and returns `null`.
> [!IMPORTANT] > XamlDirective is a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> subclass.
As with <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember>, XamlDirective has security considerations regarding how the XAML type system reports access.
See Remarks in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> class, specifying values for a name and a single XAML namespace.
Use this signature only when you want or expect <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown*> to report <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> for the directive.
> [!IMPORTANT] > This signature of the constructor always generates an identifier for the directive where <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown%2A> reports `true` for the XAML type system.

If the necessary information is available (the backing type and a text syntax information item for conversion) and you want an identifier that can apply the directive, use the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=fullName> constructor signature instead.

If you use this signature, the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective.AllowedLocation%2A> value for the instance is <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations>; and the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Type%2A> value and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.TypeConverter%2A> value are both `null`.
The primary XAML namespace where this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> can exist.
The identifying name of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> class, specifying values for each per-case value of a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
You must use this constructor to generate a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> that does not report <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown%2A> as `true`.
A set of XAML namespaces where this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> can exist, passed as an enumerable set of the identifier strings.
The identifying name of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
The XAML type that backs the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
The type converter that this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> uses for text syntax conversion.
A value of the <xref href="System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations"></xref> enumeration.
The xamlType parameter is .
Gets a value that specifies the XAML node types where the directive can be specified.

You can set this value in the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective.%23ctor%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7BSystem.String%7D%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Xaml.XamlType%2CSystem.Xaml.Schema.XamlValueConverter%7BSystem.ComponentModel.TypeConverter%7D%2CSystem.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations%29> constructor signature.

If you construct by using the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> constructor signature, the AllowedLocation value for the instance is <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations>.
However, the instance always reports <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown%2A> as `true`.
This behavior typically affects attempts to write object graphs and also affects other practical uses of a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember> value.
You typically would not construct a XAML directive case where AllowedLocation is <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations?displayProperty=fullName>.
A value of the enumeration.
The default is the enumeration default, which is <xref href="System.Xaml.Schema.AllowedMemberLocations"></xref>.
Returns the hash code for this object.
An integer hash code.
Returns a list of XAML namespaces where this XAML member can exist.
The XAML namespace identifiers are strings that typically appear in the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) string form according to the usual conventions for XAML and XML namespaces.
If the list contains more than one item, the first item in the set is usually the relevant primary XAML namespace for processing purposes, and the other items are alternates.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.PreferredXamlNamespace%2A?displayProperty=fullName> relies on this ordering.
A list of XAML namespace identifiers, as strings.
Returns an <xref href="System.Reflection.ICustomAttributeProvider"></xref> implementation.
This implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Because a XAML directive cannot have custom attributes, this implementation always returns `null`.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns a <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.XamlValueConverter%601> object, which is used during deferred loading of XAML-declared objects.
This implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Because a directive cannot have deferred loading, this implementation always returns `null`.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns a list of <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlMember"></xref> objects.
The list reports the members where dependency relationships for initialization order exist relative to this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlMember"></xref>.
This implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Because a XAML directive cannot have initialization order, this implementation always returns `null`.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns the <xref href="System.Xaml.Schema.XamlMemberInvoker"></xref> that is associated with a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
This method may be invoked by calls to <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Invoker%2A>.
This implementation returns an internal static <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.XamlMemberInvoker> value that is specific to directives in the XAML type system.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
The <xref href="System.Xaml.Schema.XamlMemberInvoker"></xref> information for this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlMember"></xref>.
Returns whether this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlMember"></xref> is reported as an ambient property.
Because a XAML directive cannot be an ambient type, this implementation always returns `false`.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> represents an event.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> represents an intended read-only property.
By definition, directives are settable.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> represents a property that has a public <xref uid="langword_csharp_get" name="get" href=""></xref> accessor.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> represents a member that is not resolvable by the backing system that is used for type and member resolution.
The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> implementation only calls base and does nothing more.

The base implementation returns the results in this order: the results are based on internal reflection; or the results are based on checking for a null value of the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.UnderlyingMember%2A>.
The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> implementation seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> represents a non-resolvable member; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> represents an intended write-only property.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref> represents a property that has a public <xref uid="langword_csharp_set" name="set" href=""></xref> accessor.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Returns the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the type where the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlMember"></xref> can exist.
This implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Target types are not relevant for directives; therefore, this implementation always returns `null`.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the type that is used by the member.
The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> implementation only calls base and does nothing more.
The base implementation returns results based either on internal reflection, or checking for a null value of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.UnderlyingMember%2A>, processing in that order.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
See Remarks in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.LookupType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> for more information about what information <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Type%2A> carries.
The <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the type that is used by the member.
Returns a type converter implementation that is associated with this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> implementation only calls base and does nothing more.
See <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.LookupTypeConverter%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.

A <xref:System.Xaml.Schema.XamlValueConverter%601> instance that has <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> constraint; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_get" name="get" href=""></xref> accessor that is associated with this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
This implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns a CLR reflection <xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfo> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
This implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_set" name="set" href=""></xref> accessor that is associated with this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
This implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> seals this virtual member; therefore, all <xref:System.Xaml.XamlDirective> types and all predefined XAML directives must use this behavior.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns a string representation of this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
If XAML namespace information is available, this implementation returns a string combination of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.PreferredXamlNamespace%2A> and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Name%2A>.
If XAML namespace information is unavailable, this implementation returns <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.Name%2A>.
A string representation of this <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlDirective"></xref>.
